content.description: Climb straight up the face just left of Billy Bong Thornton. Follow the bolts. Lower off.
content.location: Starts in the same area as Billy Bong Thornton and Not the Lamb.

content.description: Unknown route of Unknown grade. 2 bolts for the start and gear protected cracks for the rest. Anchor in a weird place to the left. Lower off.
content.location: Starts in the gully with two bolts. just left of "Now that's a Titty".

content.description: Brief unprotected foot traverse start and then up finger and hand crack. Lower off.
content.protection: .5”-2.5”. 2-bolt ring anchor in a weird place just to the right of the finish.
content.location: Start of the route is located behind the juniper that is closest to the wall.

content.description: Right leaning seam/series of pods. Place gear where you can, clip bolts where you can’t. Two ways to finish from the last bolt; either climb directly up and then step left onto the rail, or hand traverse the rail. Lower off.
content.protection: Tiny to 2 inches, 3 protection bolts. Mussy anchor.
content.location: Starts with a right leaning seam and series of thin pods, directly behind the juniper tree closest to the wall. Finishes just right of a visible pine tree.

content.description: Easy face climbing up the water streak with 2 bolts (gray hangers) and a couple cams gets you to a diagonal break/small ledge. From here the fun begins, clip a bolt and head up the interesting series of pods, place gear in the first couple pods and then clip 3 bolts on the way to the anchor. Each move gets progressively harder, culminating with a potentially baffling last move. Lower off. full 30m if belaying below.
content.protection: BD .2 to .5 or equivalents. 6 protection bolts. 2 bolt anchor with lower-offs.
content.location: Next route left of 40oz to Freedom. Starts about 5m up the gully between the lower and higher wall, 2 bolts with gray hangers in a water streak mark the start of the route. It works alright for the belayer to position at the very base of the gully.
This route follows the longest and most conspicuous traverse crack on the wall.  Belay from the 2-bolt ring anchor for the unknown route down and right of the finish.

content.description:
Cryptic and sustained face climbing. Finishes at the previously established two-bolt rap anchor under a juniper. Lower off.

*This route is a good approach/descent for the climbs above (Pepino Pillar/Dog’s Fright).
content.location: Leftmost route on the Higher Wall.

content.description: A low crux an easier middle and an exciting finish up finger locks. Use caution getting to the high-ish first bolt or stick-clip. Crux is a tricky to read boulder problem above the first bolt. 18m. Lower off.
content.protection: tips-tight hands or equivalents should cover all the possibilities.  4 protection bolts, two-bolt anchor with rings.
content.location: Just left of the alcove where Gateway Drug starts.

content.description: Starts in an alcove, hand and finger crack. Finishes at a 2-bolt anchor just up and left of the pine tree. Lower off.
Crack start and then slab climbing with some occasional discontinuous cracks. A few large runouts exist however the most difficult sections are near bolts. Lower off.
content.protection: a couple of small to 1 inch pieces, 4 protection bolts. 2-bolt anchor.
content.location: Rightmost route on the wall. Starts in a crack with a few flakes and blocks and then heads up slab.

content.description: Right leaning crack/seam for the first half and then left leaning crack/seam for the upper half. The tricky parts are bolt protected. Lower off.
content.protection: tips - tight hands, 3 protection bolts, 2-bolt anchor with lower-offs.
content.location: Starts in the same area as Not the Lamb.

content.description: A long fun and varied pitch.  Well bolted.  Mostly face climbing but ends in the right facing flake.
content.location: First route on the buttress just right of Yes Please 5.7.
